block.p: Bridget Claire Kule, a daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Christopher A. Kule of Brooklyn, was married yesterday to Brandon Wilson Lower, the son of Mr. and Mrs. Louis G. Lower II of Winnetka, Ill. The Rev. Jay Sidebotham performed the ceremony at St. Bartholomew's Episcopal Church in Manhattan.

Mrs. Lower, 25, was until April a design assistant at Branca Inc., an interior design business in Chicago. She graduated from Yale University and studied at the Harrington Institute of Interior Design. Her father is a lawyer in Manhattan. Her mother, Mary Jo Kule, is a social worker at the Cobble Hill Health Center in Brooklyn.

Bridget Claire Kule, a daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Christopher A. Kule of Brooklyn, was married yesterday to Brandon Wilson Lower, the son of Mr. and Mrs. Louis G. Lower II of Winnetka, Ill. The Rev. Jay Sidebotham performed the ceremony at St. Bartholomew's Episcopal Church in Manhattan.

Mrs. Lower, 25, was until April a design assistant at Branca Inc., an interior design business in Chicago. She graduated from Yale University and studied at the Harrington Institute of Interior Design. Her father is a lawyer in Manhattan. Her mother, Mary Jo Kule, is a social worker at the Cobble Hill Health Center in Brooklyn.

Mr. Lower, 27, received a master's degree in management from Northwestern University last week. In July, he is to become an associate in the corporate finance department of William Blair & Company, the investment bank in Chicago. He graduated from Yale. His father is the president and chief executive of the Horace Mann Educators Corporation, an insurance company in Springfield, Ill.
